RSVD0.name: RSVD0
RSVD0.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.

TXCAL45DN.name: TXCAL45DN
TXCAL45DN.description: Decode to select a 45-Ohm resistance to the USB_DN output pin

RSVD1.name: RSVD1
RSVD1.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.

TXCAL45DP.name: TXCAL45DP
TXCAL45DP.description: Decode to select a 45-Ohm resistance to the USB_DP output pin

USBPHY_TX_EDGECTRL.name: USBPHY_TX_EDGECTRL
USBPHY_TX_EDGECTRL.description: Controls the edge-rate of the current sensing transistors used in HS transmit

ENVADJ.name: ENVADJ
ENVADJ.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

DISCONADJ.name: DISCONADJ
DISCONADJ.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

ENVADJ.name: ENVADJ
ENVADJ.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

DISCONADJ.name: DISCONADJ
DISCONADJ.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

ENVADJ.name: ENVADJ
ENVADJ.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

DISCONADJ.name: DISCONADJ
DISCONADJ.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

ENVADJ.name: ENVADJ
ENVADJ.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

DISCONADJ.name: DISCONADJ
DISCONADJ.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

ENHOSTDISCONDETECT.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
ENHOSTDISCONDETECT.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

ENIRQHOSTDISCON.name: ENIRQHOSTDISCON
ENIRQHOSTDISCON.description: Enables interrupt for detection of disconnection to Device when in high-speed host mode

HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in high-speed mode

ENDEVPLUGINDETECT.name: ENDEVPLUGINDETECT
ENDEVPLUGINDETECT.description: For device mode, enables 200-KOhm pullups for detecting connectivity to the host.

DEVPLUGIN_POLARITY.name: DEVPLUGIN_POLARITY
DEVPLUGIN_POLARITY.description: For device mode, if this bit is cleared to 0, then it trips the interrupt if the device is plugged in

OTG_ID_CHG_IRQ.name: OTG_ID_CHG_IRQ
OTG_ID_CHG_IRQ.description: OTG ID change interrupt. Indicates the value of ID pin changed.

ENOTGIDDETECT.name: ENOTGIDDETECT
ENOTGIDDETECT.description: Enables circuit to detect resistance of MiniAB ID pin.

RESUMEIRQSTICKY.name: RESUMEIRQSTICKY
RESUMEIRQSTICKY.description: Set to 1 will make RESUME_IRQ bit a sticky bit until software clear it

ENIRQRESUMEDETECT.name: ENIRQRESUMEDETECT
ENIRQRESUMEDETECT.description: Enables interrupt for detection of a non-J state on the USB line

RESUME_IRQ.name: RESUME_IRQ
RESUME_IRQ.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after suspend

ENIRQDEVPLUGIN.name: ENIRQDEVPLUGIN
ENIRQDEVPLUGIN.description: Enables interrupt for the detection of connectivity to the USB line.

DEVPLUGIN_IRQ.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
DEVPLUGIN_IRQ.description: Indicates that the device is connected

DATA_ON_LRADC.name: DATA_ON_LRADC
DATA_ON_LRADC.description: Enables the LRADC to monitor USB_DP and USB_DM. This is for use in non-USB modes only.

ENUTMILEVEL2.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
ENUTMILEVEL2.description: Enables UTMI+ Level2. This should be enabled if needs to support LS device

ENIRQWAKEUP.name: ENIRQWAKEUP
ENIRQWAKEUP.description: Enables interrupt for the wakeup events.

WAKEUP_IRQ.name: WAKEUP_IRQ
WAKEUP_IRQ.description: Indicates that there is a wakeup event

ENAUTO_PWRON_PLL.name: ENAUTO_PWRON_PLL
ENAUTO_PWRON_PLL.description: Enables the feature to auto-enable the POWER bit of HW_CLKCTRL_PLLxCTRL0 if there is wakeup event if USB is suspended

ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE
ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD
ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHYx_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

ENDPDMCHG_WKUP.name: ENDPDMCHG_WKUP
ENDPDMCHG_WKUP.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if DP/DM is toggled when USB is suspended

ENIDCHG_WKUP.name: ENIDCHG_WKUP
ENIDCHG_WKUP.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if ID is toggled when USB is suspended.

ENVBUSCHG_WKUP.name: ENVBUSCHG_WKUP
ENVBUSCHG_WKUP.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if VBUS is toggled when USB is suspended.

FSDLL_RST_EN.name: FSDLL_RST_EN
FSDLL_RST_EN.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

OTG_ID_VALUE.name: OTG_ID_VALUE
OTG_ID_VALUE.description: Almost same as OTGID_STATUS in USBPHYx_STATUS Register

HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0
HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with LS timing

UTMI_SUSPENDM.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM
UTMI_SUSPENDM.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state

SFTRST.name: SFTRST
SFTRST.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHYx_PWD, USBPHYx_TX, USBPHYx_RX, and USBPHYx_CTRL registers

ENHOSTDISCONDETECT.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

SFTRST.name: SFTRST

HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS
HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected while in high-speed host mode.

DEVPLUGIN_STATUS.name: DEVPLUGIN_STATUS
DEVPLUGIN_STATUS.description: Indicates that the device has been connected on the USB_DP and USB_DM lines.

OTGID_STATUS.name: OTGID_STATUS
OTGID_STATUS.description: Indicates the results of ID pin on MiniAB plug

RESUME_STATUS.name: RESUME_STATUS
RESUME_STATUS.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after suspend and has triggered an interrupt.

OTGIDPIOLOCK.name: OTGIDPIOLOCK
OTGIDPIOLOCK.description: Once OTG ID from USBPHYx_STATUS_OTGID_STATUS, use this to hold the value

DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD.name: DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD
DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD.description: Use holding registers to assist in timing for external UTMI interface.

HSTPULLDOWN.name: HSTPULLDOWN
HSTPULLDOWN.description: Set bit 3 to 1 to pull down 15-KOhm on USB_DP line

ENHSTPULLDOWN.name: ENHSTPULLDOWN
ENHSTPULLDOWN.description: Set bit 5 to 1 to override the control of the USB_DP 15-KOhm pulldown

TX2RXCOUNT.name: TX2RXCOUNT
TX2RXCOUNT.description: Delay in between the end of transmit to the beginning of receive

ENTX2RXCOUNT.name: ENTX2RXCOUNT
ENTX2RXCOUNT.description: Set this bit to allow a countdown to transition in between TX and RX.

SQUELCHRESETCOUNT.name: SQUELCHRESETCOUNT
SQUELCHRESETCOUNT.description: Delay in between the detection of squelch to the reset of high-speed RX.

ENSQUELCHRESET.name: ENSQUELCHRESET
ENSQUELCHRESET.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.

SQUELCHRESETLENGTH.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH
SQUELCHRESETLENGTH.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

HOST_RESUME_DEBUG.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG
HOST_RESUME_DEBUG.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.

OTGIDPIOLOCK.description: Once OTG ID from USBPHYx_STATUS_OTGID_STATUS, use this to hold the value

ENSQUELCHRESET.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.

SQUELCHRESETLENGTH.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH
SQUELCHRESETLENGTH.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

HOST_RESUME_DEBUG.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG
HOST_RESUME_DEBUG.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.

LOOP_BACK_FAIL_COUNT.name: LOOP_BACK_FAIL_COUNT
LOOP_BACK_FAIL_COUNT.description: Running count of the failed pseudo-random generator loopback

SQUELCH_COUNT.name: SQUELCH_COUNT
SQUELCH_COUNT.description: Running count of the squelch reset instead of normal end for HS RX.

RSVD0.name: RSVD0
RSVD0.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.

ENTAILADJVD.name: ENTAILADJVD
ENTAILADJVD.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch: 00 = Delay is nominal 01 = Delay is +20% 10 = Delay is -20% 11 = Delay is -40%

RSVD0.name: RSVD0
RSVD0.description: Reserved. Note: This bit should remain clear.

ENTAILADJVD.name: ENTAILADJVD
ENTAILADJVD.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch: 00 = Delay is nominal 01 = Delay is +20% 10 = Delay is -20% 11 = Delay is -40%

STEP.name: STEP
STEP.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the stepping of the RTL version.

MINOR.name: MINOR
MINOR.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MINOR field of the RTL version.

MAJOR.name: MAJOR
MAJOR.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MAJOR field of the RTL version.
